rComments: You must be ready to work but shes there to help. The tests are just a lot of memorization

Fairly easy class. All you need is decent test scores for the midterms and final. (I got C, C-, and C-) and passed the class with a B+ (without buying textbook). Lots of "notes" you have to take. You're going to have to either review the slides yourself on ecommons,  or take super fast/crazy notes in lecture (dont recommend), or notes from textbook
Took this class after dropping Physics for the GE. She powers through 50-80 slide lectures in 1.5 hour lectures. Lot of self-learning. Good TA makes or breaks your lab experiences.

She literally speeds through 70-100 slides within an hour and 45 mins HOWEVER, she posts the slides online(bye bye textbook), along with review sheets for the midterm(which practically is all you need to know for it). While you could pass the class without going to all the lectures, she MIGHT offer EC to those who stay. Lots of memorization though.

Really challenging course to pass. Lectures over simplified the course material, and then the exams were extremely detail-oriented and challenging. Textbook was non-mandatory, but expect to be teaching yourself the material if you want to pass.

Everyone in this class complains a ton. Yes she goes through a ton of slides each lecture, however she puts them all online along with study guides. And its a science class, you are going to learn science material and its going to be hard. Don't be fooled by the fact that its a GE. That does not mean it is an easy A. If you like the ocean, take it.
ok class.. if you aren't a marine bio major its going to suck. it isn't as easy as she says it is. I dislike the class a lot and don't go to lecture but still have an A... overall mediocre.

I enrolled in this class thinking that it would be easy to get an A, but ended up regretting. She goes through like 80slides on one day without explaining them cleary. You need to study and memorize a ridiculous amount of things all by yourself. Both midterm and final were difficult. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS for a GE course. Avoid.

Took this class for my SI GE, but it was garbage. She zooms through 70 slide (each) lectures w/ zero time to write anything down. The exam averages are low (60%) for a GE course, and at this point in the quarter she has no intent to curve them. Hardest class ever taken. Mandatory lab, grueling exams, research projects. Stay. Away. Please.
